availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Deborah "Debby" Duke Stevens in Ohio County, Kentucky, on September 7, 1819. Married to Susan Stateler Stevens in Ohio County on September 6, 1838. Father of Laura Deborah Stevens Taylor, Emily Stevens, Martha J. Stevens Ezell, Lucy H. Stevens Taylor, James K. Stevens, and Fidelia W. Stevens. Farmer in Ohio County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Ohio County in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Recommended for an appointment as Justice of the Peace in Ohio County on October 30, 1862.
